newsitem.title: USA: April paper Brent mixed in active late U.S. trade.
newsitem.headline: April paper Brent mixed in active late U.S. trade.

text.p: North Sea Brent paper for April was mixed in active late U.S. trading, after falling to a seven-month low of $18.80 a barrel in London.
In the U.S. aftermarket, six partial April Brent cargoes changed hands from $18.88 to $18.95 a barrel.
The International Petroleum Exchange (IPE) settled at $18.90 a barrel for the front-month contract.
Intermonth spreads were steady. March/April spreads moved at plus 26 and plus 30 cents a barrel, after trading at plus 27 cents earlier in the day.
April/May traded at plus 23 cents, compared to earlier trades of plus 22 and plus 25 cents.
